pros: Great learning experience throughout my time as a student worker

job_title: Defensive Coordinator-Assistant Football Coach in Harrisburg, PA
pros: Quality personnel with integrity and class.
cons: Lack of financial commitment and support.

job_title: Student Activities Assistant in Greenville, PA
pros: Good atmosphere, love my boss, and the perks are good as a student.
cons: Scheduling isn't the best and I'm not sure when I'll work.

pros: Pros-I have had the pleasure of working at Thiel for more than ten years.  The College has a committed faculty and staff, diverse student body and has played an important role in regional economic development.  I am proud that Thiel chooses to be a diverse community.  Our international and multi-cultural student population is significantly higher than other private schools in the area.  We continue to engage students and encourage success in all facets of their college experience.  Thiel is a place where staff, faculty and administrators knows students by name.  It is a community of committed life long learners who care about one another.
cons: Cons-We have experience faculty and staff turnover and while it is always hard to see people leave, in some instances that has led to improvement and innovation.

pros: It is great to work with/for a purpose. The culture is mostly supportive and offers many opportunities to grow, take on greater responsibilities and feel empowered to try new things. In recent years, the College has diligently worked to reinvent itself to be more competitive in a competitive marketplace. Lots of opportunity here.
cons: The current leadership inherited some conditions, which resulted in some set backs, as a result things move quickly in the background, but not always where most can see, creating a level of frustration and impatience, Thiel is resilient and will become stronger than ever.

review_title: Was a great place to work, current management driving it into the ground
pros: They were employee friendly.  Everyone was like family.  Very flexible on hours.
cons: Used to have excellent benefits but current management has eliminated most of them.  Most long term (5+ years) employees are leaving.  This is no longer the "feel like family" environment it used to be.

pros: The most helpful, friendly and cooperative administration, faculty and staff overall that I have ever worked with in higher education. (Most colleges and universities these days are pretty lousy places to work.) Fringe benefits package for employees is excellent (which is not to say it could not be better), a little bit less so for employee family members because of premium costs.
cons: Salaries and wages are low, even for an area that has a very low cost of housing.

pros: Relaxed work environment. I had an awesome supervisor. The academic environment was an enriching experience. People are very helpful and generous with their time.
cons: Pay was a little lower than expected. I had to drive a long way to get there. It was a challenge during winter months especially. My office had no ventilation so working during summer months was a challenge.

pros: There isn't much pressure for publications. The teaching load  is relatively light compared to similar positions. Housing in the area is pretty inexpensive.
cons: Weak students. Not much in the surrounding area to do. Benefits could be improved, particularly for faculty members with children.

review_title: Thiel College is a great place to work as a starting place in working in higher education.
pros:
Small campus- you know everyone and they are willing to help you out
Lots of fun events throughout the year to keep you busy
cons:
Sometimes you have to do a lot yourself because the staff is small.
It's a VERY small town with not a lot around you.

pros: Many job opportunities, plenty of flexibility in hours, often times beneficial to others on campus.
cons: hardly any room for increase pay. Minimum wage for minimum # of hours.  Sometimes student workers treated bad.

review_title: Wish I would have been here years ago!  What's not to like!
pros: Vibrant faculty and staff; energetic students; a college that is on the move!
cons: Work on campus is wonderful, but the lack of stores in the community is sometimes a downside.

review_title: Working for Thiel College has given me the opportunity for growth and learning
pros: Many opportunities to learn different trades and the people are always friendly/
cons: I was a a student while working here/

review_title: Thiel offers many on campus jobs
pros: Can work when you want, can pick any job you want really.
cons: have to dress certain way, have to work weekends

pros: Room stipen. Flexible hours. Intense and fun training.
cons: Technically on call 24/7. Can, rarely, put your life on the line.
